virtuals.subtitle: “What we want is not more little books about Christianity, but more little books by Christians on other subjects — with their Christianity…

paragraphs.text: Thanks for this, Justin Cox 🍩! Like you, I’m a minister, but don’t broadcast it (there are stigmas too often attached to it). To be honest, I enjoy writing from a different perspective that’s outside the weird ideals of American Christendom or on subjects that have nothing to do with faith. My challenge to you would not even necessarily be to write…

paragraphs.text: My weekly writing goal is to simply write once a week and share my writing. I am a novice writer myself, but I teach my middle school writing students to write and share frequently. I want to show them that I will follow my own advice and work to be a better writer every week.

paragraphs.name: bb2e
paragraphs.text: a weekly exploration of faith in our currently reality. When I’m not trolling the Medium waters, I’m a Minister to Youth and Families in Orlando. I write about faith a lot in that world, but only ever publish the sermons I give. Perhaps I could follow in the footsteps of Benjamin Sledge and Dave Boice, and tell stories about exploring faith.
Recount stories about your daughter every week
